description: T.25 Indian Cedar:1. (Long lateral limb to North-East situated approximately 6 meters from ground level) - Reduce limb by up to 2 meters to reduce end weight and to shape into existing canopy2. (Long lateral limb to South-West situated approximately 9 meters from ground level) - Reduce limb by up to 2 meters to reduce end weight and to shape into existing canopy3. (Small diameter hanging branch to North over road situated approximately 12 meters from ground level) - Remove hanging branch4. (Low canopy to North and South) - Reduce lowest branch to North by up to 2 meters to clear away from road and remove lowest small diameter branch to South-West back to main stem5. (Dead wood within canopy) - Remove dead wood
